result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicole M Kopac was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with Standard Release Conditions.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

miscConds.notes: Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicole M Kopac

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

2:29 PM Defendant Nicole M Kopac in court.  Attorney Timothy Mistrioty in court for Nicole M Kopac.  Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant enters a guilty plea to count #1. Court conducts colloquy and finds the Defendant guilty of count #1. 

State makes sentencing arguments. Defense makes sentencing arguments. Defendant makes statements. 
Court orders the following:
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
45 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS. 
Consecutive to: any other sentence

Term of Probation: 12 Months

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

COSTS:  $243.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

1:40 PM Defendant Nicole M Kopac in court.  Attorney Timothy Mistrioty in court for Nicole M Kopac.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense has received discovery on newest case, and requests a projected plea/sentencing hearing in about 60 days. Defense makes request to remove SCRAM monitoring as a bail condition or to amend bond on 22CM653 to Signature bond only. 
State agrees to address bond today. 
Defense makes statements in support of request to bail modification. 
State makes arguments in opposition to request for bail modification. 
For reasons on the record, the court will deny the request for bail modification.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

Court sets a Signature Bond in the amount of $1,000
CONDITIONS:
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. 
Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
Not to be on any premises that serve/sell/provide alcohol - Only exception is the Grocery Store and not to enter the liquor department.

Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Nicole M Kopac in court with attorney Timothy Mistrioty. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.

State presented their bail arguments.
Defense presented their bail arguments.

Court sets a Signature Bond in the amount of $1,000
CONDITIONS:
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. 
Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
Not to be on any premises that serve/sell/provide alcohol - Only exception is the Grocery Store and not to enter the liquor department.  Hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on June 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
